alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:14PM EST until February 21 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Racine Lock affecting Meigs and Mason Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Racine Lock. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Monday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 35.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 42.6 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.7 feet on 01/11/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM EST.
